attributes.action: investigate poor service by the Home Office, not properly reviewing information supplied, and giving false information, costing applicants unnecessary fees.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
My experience of the Home Office has shocked me after accompanying my girlfriend there to get her ‘Indefinite leave to Remain’ transferred from her old Passport to her new one.
Although there was a slight complication, she wrote to the Home Office requesting advice on this, and which form she should use, and referred back to previous information given to her by the Home Office.
The result was still a 'declined' application, a loss of £515 in application costs, and no explanation why, only suggesting she tries again (another £515), or returns to S.Africa where she has no family, and being separated from her 14 year old son who is British and about to start GCSEs. When asked about the advice given to her letter, they told her it was ‘a different department’, and that its 'not their problem'.
This is made even harder to understand when you consider most of her family are British citizens, and her Grand father fought for this country in the RAF.
It appears this is by no means a one off case!
